snippet: The University of Alabama at Birmingham announced in December it would no longer field a football team, but the resulting outcry has it rethinking its decision.
abstract: University of Alabama at Birmingham, in response to outcry from students, faculty and major donors, will reassess plans to end Division I football program; task force will examine independent consulting firm's findings that led to initial decision and review finances of athletic department, which has majority of its $30 million budget subsidized by university.

byline.original: By ZACH SCHONBRUN and BEN STRAUSS

lead_paragraph: The University of Alabama at Birmingham announced in December it would no longer field a football team, but the resulting outcry has it rethinking its decision.

headline.main: After U.A.B. Program’s Death, Outcry Raises the Possibility of a Quick Resurrection
headline.print_headline: After U.A.B. Program’s Death, Outcry Raises the Possibility of a Quick Resurrection
